name: Royal Ramblas Hotel

reviews.text: The hotel is supposed to be four star - not in my world it wasn't! The staff were surly on the desk and the rooms were dismal. The bed had a plastic undersheet that russled every time you moved and made you feel like you were staying in a care home for the elderly.
reviews.title: Awful!

reviews.text: My room was too hot the air con wasn't switched on and on opening the window for air the room stank of frying bacon from the kitchen I suppose. I complained but was told there was absolutely nothing that could be done. I got no sleep as the next door room were obviously rekindling their love life and the sound proofing was non existent.
reviews.title: Try other hotels, certainly not this one

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had the pleasure of visiting the hotel's restaurant - though restaurant is not what I'd call it. The staff were even more repugnant and the pizza I had was unbelievably bad. This whole experience cost 250 euros for two nights - my advice is don't ever ever ever stay at this hotel it was a revolting experience.
reviews.title: A Perfect Stay

reviews.text: This is the worst hotel I have ever stayed for the past 30 years.
reviews.title: Great Location! Great Rooms! Good Service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is absolutely not a 4-star hotel.A 2-star may be.
reviews.title: Great base for a short stay

reviews.text: I had a most pleasant experience while staying at the Royal Hotel. Check-in was Nov 30th and they had a room available for my early arrival. The front desk staff , as well as the bellman were friendly and spoke English.
reviews.title: Pleasant Experience

reviews.text: The room itself, tho a bit narrow, was clean, providing twin beds, a table with 2 chairs, ample closet and shelf space, a safe, and a refrigerator. The frig was filled with various drinks and snacks. The only problem was if you wished to purchase your own water and store it inside, they would remove it. Did not like that. A televison was also available but I did not turn it on so can't comment on what was available for viewing.
reviews.title: My Home in Barca

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bathroom was large enough with a nice tub/shower, good water pressure with plenty of hot water, nice sink area with room for personal items, and a hair dryer.
reviews.title: Location-location-location

reviews.text: Computer access was wireless and easy to use. You could buy minutes or get the daily plan, which was the most cost efficient. Naturally you would need a converter if you are from the states.
reviews.title: Very Disappointing Viewl

likes.disliked: — The poor view, and lack of facilities fit of a4 star hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was definately convenient to Los Ramblas, which was right out the door. Tho my room faced that street, the noise was minimal even with the window slightly open. I was located on the top floor so that may have helped cut down on noise.
reviews.title: Great hotel for week end break

likes.disliked: — Not a proper bar inthe hotel just a lounge area with vending machines but so many closeby not really a problem

reviews.title: Anniversary on Ramblas
reviews.text: The hotel certainly lived up to being a 4-star. The rooms were excellent, warm atmosphere,nicely decorated with real wood finish, so refreshing contrast to usual modern format. Well appointed bathroom.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service was good and very helpful, room service being efficient with low friendly profile.
reviews.title: Great Location, Great Hotel - Absolutely

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Air conditioning ensured a comfortable room temperature, easily adjusted to individual preferences.
reviews.title: A Fantastic Hotel in a Wonderful City

likes.liked: — Barcelona and its location within the city

reviews.text: Our rooms (3rd Floor) looked out onto the Ramblas but the windows kept out virtually all the noise from below, but when opened allowed a pleasant view on the antics below, a nice way to settle on our Spring evening!
reviews.title: Las Ramblas Great Location
Excellent
reviews.text: We had breakfast each day in the hotel, which was an excellent self-service buffet, which set one up well for the day. With the numerous restaurants nearby, a relaxing stay (5 nights) was easy.

reviews.title: great Location
reviews.text: After i had booked Royal Ramblas was a bit worried, because it had two bad reviews in February . I need not have worried, yes one of the guys on receiption was not pleasant, but so what, he was the only one. The hotel is ideally situated at top of Ramblas, great for arriving late at night when your not sure where to go. Breakfast was great! it was included in our package, room we had was spacious although it was situated at back of hotel, but i had requested a quiet room and thats what we got. Would stay here again, hotel is spotless.

reviews.title: Perfect Location
reviews.text: The location of the hotel is perfect for visitors to Barcelona. Right on the Las Ramblas - the "heart of the city" allows travelers to come and go during the day to rest and freshen up before heading out on another adventure.

reviews.title: Certainly not a 4* Hotel
reviews.text: We would definitely stay there again and recommend it to all those who enjoy comfort and convenience.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked this hotel for 4 nights - special treat for my husband's 50th birthday. Thought I would go the extra for somewhere special as the occasion was special. What a mistake!!
reviews.title: Royal Hotel - Las Ramblas

reviews.text: Reception area was minimal, bedrooms were very small to say the least. Yes there was a lovely big bed there - 4* bed - that was all. I was so disappointed. Complained at reception - he said I had the 'superior room' - God help the ones booked into the normal rooms!! Overall, it was a 2* Hotel and definetly not anywhere near a 4*. The location was perfect, and to be fair, the hotel refunded me the next 3 days, as there was no way I was staying there any longer.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel for 7 nights in a superior room, which I found to be excellent. The view from the room was good, and there was no noise from the ramblas due to the excellent double glazing. The room was kept immaculately clean and fresh and sheets and pillow cases were changed daily. We could make tea at any time as there was a facility room adjacent to the corridor where there were tables, and books etc left presumably by fellow travellers. Staff were efficient and friendly.
reviews.title: excellent hotel on the ramblas

likes.liked: — quality of accomodation and the central location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel restaurant, was open to the general public, and although the food was good, being a very busy restaurant, staff made no difference between residents at the hotel and people dropping in from the street.
reviews.title: Book a Superior Design Ramblas View Room

likes.disliked: — Perhaps the size of the room itself, slightly small, but realize most European hotels are smaller.

reviews.text: There is a lovely local type restaurant, which served good breakfasts and meals, at a very reasonable price, in the street to the left directly opposite the front door of the hotel. The restaurant was named SantAna and was aprroximatley 100 metres along that street on the right hand side.
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay

likes.disliked: — Can be noisy if window left open

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel could not be more central or easier to reach from the airport.
reviews.title: Great location in a great city!

likes.disliked: — Our king bed was two twin beds pushed together!

reviews.title: loved the royal
reviews.text: If you are lucky enough to have one of the rooms looking on to the ramblas, see if you can spot the team of about 10 people, who operate the the scam with the domino type game. See the slim man with baseball

description: The Royal Ramblas is a first class hotel with a privileged location right at the top of Las Ramblas boulevard, close to Catalunya Square. The hotel is within walking distance to the most fashionable area in Barcelona for shopping and entertainment and it is located in the perfect place to live the real Barcelona experience. The hotel is a modern property and guestrooms have been recently renovated. Some of the rooms are overlooking the famous Ramblas, the best views of the city.
